[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=4402880]

In this week's spec ops we have seen a massive jailbreak from a team known as Red Teams. They have found an exploit that allows them to completely break through the security measures in chat GPT-5.

Red teams from NeuralTrust and SPLX have dealt a major blow to GPT-5‚Äôs credibility as an enterprise tool, breaching its safeguards in under 24 hours through layered ‚Äústorytelling‚Äù jailbreaks that bypassed safety filters and coerced the model into producing dangerous instructions. SecurityWeek reports that these findings expose significant vulnerabilities in GPT-5‚Äôs architecture, rendering it ‚Äúnearly unusable for enterprise‚Äù without aggressive hardening and continuous monitoring. The incident underscores the growing tension between AI innovation and the operational realities of securing next-generation models against sophisticated adversarial prompts.

The 2025 cybersecurity landscape is equally volatile, with AI emerging as both a frontline defense and a weaponized threat. Governments in the U.K. and U.S. have announced major funding and guidance to secure critical infrastructure, even as budget cuts to CISA and military cyber units raise concerns about resilience against nation-state attacks. Meanwhile, ransomware gangs are targeting platforms like SharePoint with AI-enhanced tactics, tool sprawl is hampering SecOps efficiency, and firms like Bitdefender are launching advisory services to close security gaps. From Anthropic‚Äôs Claude dominating cyber competitions to Microsoft‚Äôs autonomous malware detection rollout, Spec Ops teams are adapting with AI-driven SIEM, zero-trust frameworks, and streamlined tooling to keep pace in an increasingly complex threat environment.

[b][url=https://www.securityweek.com/red-teams-breach-gpt-5-with-ease-warn-its-nearly-unusable-for-enterprise/]Source[/url][/b]

[color=#72FF84][b]Notable console & hardware releases:[/b][/color]

No new console was officially released in the last week.

There were however rumored leaks particularly concerning a possible Xbox handheld and next-gen console codenames (PS6 Orion, Xbox Magnus), but these remain speculative.

[color=#FFFF44]Turtle Beach made a notable splash with the announcement of three new racing game peripherals for Xbox and PC. On Tuesday, August 5th, the company unveiled and opened pre-orders for the following products:[/color]

[color=#FF5F54]VelocityOne Race KD3:[/color]

A direct-drive force feedback racing wheel and pedal system designed for a more immersive and realistic racing experience.

[color=#FF5F54]VelocityOne F-RX:[/color]

A formula-style racing wheel, also for the VelocityOne Race ecosystem.

[color=#FF5F54]Turtle Beach Racer:[/color]

A wireless racing wheel aimed at more casual racing game fans.


[color=#72FF84][b]Notable News (August 2025)[/b][/color]

[color=#FF5F54]Battlefield 6 Open Beta sets a franchise record:[/color]

Battlefield 6 has the biggest Open Beta of any Battlefield game. Battlefield 6 peaked at 473,632 concurrent players. This positions it as the fourth most-played game on Steam right now, only behind Counter-Strike 2, Dota 2, and PUBG: Battlegrounds, and ahead of EA's own Apex Legends.

[color=#FF5F54]Battlefield 6 players need to uninstall Valorant due to conflicting Anti-Cheat Software:[/color]

PC players participating in the open beta for Battlefield 6 are being told to uninstall Valorant, as the games have conflicting anti-cheat software. While the EA title is already finding incredible success ahead of its full launch in October, many Battlefield 6 players are frustrated by this requirement, with some even deciding to purchase the game for console instead.

[spoiler][img]https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Gx81dy3bcAAeLO0?format=png&name=small[/img][/spoiler]

[color=#FF5F54]"CODified" Battlefield 6 UI:[/color]

Gamers are upset that the BF6 menu is strikingly similar to Call Of Duty. Players all around the world want the old vertical menus back, but as the gaming industry advances so do corporate trends. It might not affect a title's gameplay, but a sleek and user-friendly menu interface is something gamers are extremely passionate about.

[color=#FF5F54]Gamers hoping to get a Switch 2 for the holidays may be in luck:[/color]

Since its June 5 launch, the Switch 2 has become the fastest-selling console in Nintendo's company history, with over six million units sold as of July 24. Nintendo is ramping up Switch 2 production ahead of the holidays. Due to the Trump administration's tariffs on goods from various countries, Nintendo has increased the price of the original Switch family of consoles and accessories in the US, with the Switch Lite now starting at $229 instead of $199.

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Google Pixel 10 series leaks[/color][/size][/b][/u]

The much-anticipated Google Pixel 10 lineup‚Äîincluding Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, Pro Fold, and Pro XL has surfaced in leaked images and spec details, hinting at features like a 6.8‚Ä≥ Super Actua display, 16‚ÄØGB RAM, Tensor G5 chip, and improved cameras. Samsung may soon launch the Galaxy S25 FE in Korea (and then globally), likely priced under $720. Meta also unveiled two new VR prototypes, "Tiramisu" and "Boba 3," at SIGGRAPH 2025, showcasing significant gains in visual fidelity and field of view.

It‚Äôs being deployed to Pixel 6 through Pixel 9 series, including Pixel Tablet and Fold.
